alert.note: Alert for St Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued June 10 at 4:22AM AST until June 12 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves between 6 and 8 feet. * WHERE...Eastern beaches of St Croix. Northeastern beaches of Puerto Rico and eastern beaches of Culebra. * WHEN...From this evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
